docs.lead_paragraph: Hedge fund manager William Ackman, who is betting $1.16 billion that Herbalife is a fraud, spent $264,000 last year on lobbyists to press his case against the company, according to government documents filed in recent weeks.

headline.main: Ackman Outspent by Herbalife in Lobbying Battle
headline.print_headline: Ackman Outspent by Herbalife in Lobbying Battle

docs.snippet: Hedge fund manager William Ackman, who is betting $1.16 billion that Herbalife is a fraud, spent $264,000 last year on lobbyists to press his case against the company, according to government documents filed in recent weeks.

docs.lead_paragraph: GLENN--Morton Bernard, MD, age 91 passed away at home with family by his side in West Palm Beach, FL on March 1, 2014. Formerly of New York City, Dr. Glenn was born in New York in 1922, son of Mimi and Harold Glenn. He was a graduate of the University of Pennsylvania, 1942 and New York University School of Medicine, 1946. He served in the US Naval Medical Corps, 1947-1949. Dr. Glenn was a pioneer in the treatment of obesity. He was a teacher, lecturer, consultant, author and clinician. Fellow of numerous medical societies and past president of the American College of Nutrition. Preceded in death by his wife, Justine Glenn. Beloved brother of Arnold Glenn of North Palm Beach, FL; adored father and father-in-law of Wendy Glenn and Marianne Lowenthal, Valerie Glenn Jorgensen, John Glenn and Nan, Adrienne Harkavy and Jerry, Marcia Stamberg and Arthur. Also survived by his dearly loved grandchildren, Lena, Henry, Allan, Edward, Michael and Erika, Dan and Amy, four great-grandchildren, nieces, grand nieces and nephews. Memorial service at IJ Morris at Star of David Cemetery of the Palm Beaches, 9321 Memorial Park Road, West Palm Beach, FL. March 9, 9:30am. In lieu of flowers donations may be made to Jewish Federation of Palm Beach County or Hospice of Palm Beach.

docs.lead_paragraph: As one congressman put it, “There is nothing hotter than farm to table.” The bill’s champion, Senator Debbie Stabenow, made sure the trend got a boost.

headline.main: Farm Bill Reflects Shifting American Menu and a Senator’s Persistent Tilling
headline.print_headline: Farm Bill Reflects Shifting American Menu and a Senator’s Persistent Tilling

docs.abstract: Closer examination of farm bill signed by Pres Obama reveals nation's agricultural policy is increasingly more friendly to organic farmers, fruit growers and hemp producers with emphasis on locally grown, healthful foods that appeal to broad base of constituents; while traditional commodities subsidies were cut by more than 30 percent to $23 billion over 10 years, funding for fruits and vegetables and organic programs increased by more than 50 percent over same period, to about $3 billion.
docs.snippet: As one congressman put it, “There is nothing hotter than farm to table.” The bill’s champion, Senator Debbie Stabenow, made sure the trend got a boost.

docs.lead_paragraph: How humankind unwittingly joined an experiment on antibiotics and weight gain.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Pagan Kennedy traces link between widespread use of antibiotics in America and increase in obesity rates; notes that scientists have found evidence that suggests that antibiotic usage may alter the humans' microbiomes, which in turn could be related to heavier population and rise in obesity.
docs.snippet: How humankind unwittingly joined an experiment on antibiotics and weight gain.

docs.lead_paragraph: A guide to cultural and recreational events in Connecticut.
docs.snippet: A guide to cultural and recreational events in Connecticut.

docs.lead_paragraph: In late December, President Barack Obama's new legislative affairs team sent him more than a dozen recommendations for ways to improve his strained relations with Capitol Hill. The president responded with a few ideas of his own, including a request for more social events with lawmakers at the White House.

headline.main: For Obama, a Last Stab at Improving Ties With Hill
headline.print_headline: For Obama, a Last Stab at Improving Ties With Hill
